result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan Casper Gapp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs (Heroin) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
In the Wisconsin State Prison System
Consecutive to: any other sentence
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Court advises the defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the defendant being returned to prison.

miscConds.notes: Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed. No possession of any drug paraphernalia unless pursuant to a doctor's order.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.
Seek and maintain full time work and/or school.

Provide DNA sample, if not already done so. Court ordered Defendant to comply with paying Department of Correction Supervision fees. Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

timeConds.notes: With release to the Day Reporting Center ONLY; without good time credit. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. Court denies defense request for a delayed report date.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 36 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS.  
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and for the Substance Abuse Program. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 30 MONTHS .
Conditions of probation and Extended Supervision:
- 9 months condition time at the House of Correction, with release to the Day Reporting Center ONLY, without good time credit. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia unless pursuant to a Doctors order.
- Seek and maintain FT work and/or school.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done so.
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with paying Department of Correction Supervision fees. 

Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Court denies the Defense request for a delayed report date.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.

Defendant Jonathan Casper Gapp in court with attorney Kiley Zellner.  Danielle E. Chojnacki for Brandon Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT 1:
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Case proceeds to Sentencing.

Defendant Jonathan Casper Gapp in court with attorney Kiley Zellner.  Paul Hauer for Brandon A. Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel received discovery and offer.  Court orders case for adjourned Plea and Sentencing on 9-24-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jonathan Casper Gapp in court with attorney Kiley Beth Zellner.  Brandon A. Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense has not received file from previous counsel and requesting adjournment. Court orders case adjourned for Scheduling Conference on 9-2-2014 at 9:00 a.m., Br. 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 2, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Heard in br 34 for br 26
Defendant Jonathan Casper Gapp in court with attorney Megan Barbara.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion heard and granted.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2014, this case will be assigned to:  Judge STARK, Branch 17, in ROOM 313 of the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Status conference scheduled for August 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jonathan Casper Gapp in court with attorney Megan Barbara.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court files Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for 07-25-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jonathan Casper Gapp in court with attorney Megan Barbara.  Antonella Aleman for Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. No possession of any illegal drugs. No possession of firearms or weapons.

Defendant Jonathan Casper Gapp in court with attorney Mary G Guimont.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold Defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Haring in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/27/2014 at 1:30pm
